course.subject: ISOM
course.name: A Second Course in Business Statistics
course.description: Practical application of statistics with emphasis on regression. Analysis of business data using a statistical package. Topics include: simple and multiple regression, residual diagnostics and model selection, experimental design and the analysis of variance.
course.prerequisites: ISOM 2500 or MATH 2411

reviews.author: hyjtsangaa
reviews.comment_content: Focus on how to make use of different kinds of data and regression models.  Tutorial session teach how to use R to apply what is learnt in the lectures.  Taking this course after taking ISOM3360 is an advantage as some of the content duplicates.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very detailed explanation.  Some concepts are difficult.  For the tutorial session, the TA explains every single line of R code.
reviews.comment_grading: Very good grade.  I got A- with both the midterm and final exam just above mean.
reviews.comment_workload: Need to do homework and a group case using R.  It will be difficult if you are not good at and interested in R as the R codes taught in the tutorial session cannot be fully applied to the assignments.

reviews.author: Yau Kwan:D
reviews.title: grade幾靚, 無group work, but don't expect to get much out of this course
reviews.comment_content:
教好多好多stat野
multiple regression, ANOVA, logistic regression, classification, regression tree
仲有數之不盡既test
其實無可能一個sem學識晒
reviews.comment_teaching:
可能我智商唔夠 幾乎無一堂lecture/tutorial 係聽得明 lol

lecture多數教concept, 睇唔同software gen既output

tutorial教用R, 不過如果無返咁上下數底, 應該無一堂會聽得明 (好似我咁..)
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment x3 (20%)
- 全部 above mean 少少
Case Study (15%)
- 91 <- mean 86.1
Mid Term (30%)
- 79 <- mean 64.4
Final (35%)
- 66.5 <- below 0.3 sd

*MT 同 Final 應該都 scale up 晒d分
mt final 我都有半份卷唔識 lol

Final Grade: A
我就覺得超靚grade
reviews.comment_workload:
assignment同case study可以自己做/分group做
我全部自己做所以幾chur
要打好多code (esp case study)
但係assignment跟足tutorial notes做就ok
ta 改得幾鬆手B-)

exam同教既野無直接關係
有d題目都幾math下 唔識都唔緊要
因為都幾肯定大家都唔識 lol

cheat sheet一定要抄晒lecture notes上面所有formulae!!!

reviews.author: thyc0309_
reviews.title: Not recommended for those who are not good at maths, stats and coding
reviews.comment_content:
The content is useful and practical but quite difficult. It introduces intermediate topics in statistics, predominantly on regression, as well as some concepts related to data mining and machine learning. Assignments would require you to use R to finish a series of data analysis work. If you're not prepared to code and study statistics in depth don't take this course.

Topics covered:
- Data Exploration
- Data Cleaning and Feature Engineering
- Multiple Linear Regression
- Fitting Curve to Data (Nonlinear Regression)
- Assessing assumptions of the regression model
- Regression with interaction and indicator variables
- Model Building (most difficult part)
- Logistic Regression
- Classification and Regression Tree (CART)
reviews.comment_teaching: Well, part of the reason that I decided to take this course is because I was Kris Pan's student in ISOM2500, so I was confident of her teaching ability. In this course, though, I don't want to criticize her teaching performance as it was very similar to that during her ISOM2500 (except that there were no participation cards), but it seems that the content was too difficult that no matter how she explained, I still couldn't understand much. Maybe it was due to my profound weakness at Maths and Stats...
reviews.comment_grading:
35% Assignments and case study
(Require you to perform a series of data analysis work using R. For the case study, you need to perform data analysis without any instructions and type up a report, max 10 pages)
30% Midterm
35% Final
(Midterm contains ~20% MCs and ~80% short questions, which you're required to solve problems based on the given R outputs. Final is all long questions and some of them are quite mathematical, e.g. covering linear algebra topics requiring you to find eigenvalues and eigenvectors... I bet almost nobody knows how to do those questions...)

Update:
Much to my surprise, the grading is unexpectedly lenient.
For me:
Assignment 1: 98/120 (mean: 100.9)
Assignment 2: 96/120 (mean: 109.6, SD: 6.07)
Assignment 3: 100/100 (mean: 90)
Case study: 88/100 (mean: 86.1)
Midterm: 57/100 (mean: 71.56, SD: 12.61) (the score had been scaled up a bit as told by the TA)
Final: 65/100 (mean: 71.1, SD: 14.8)

And it turns out I get a B+! (Maybe it's because the curriculum was a brand new one for this semester so Kris Pan was very benevolent in giving out good grades... bear in mind that it may be different for the upcoming semesters...)
reviews.comment_workload:
The assignment takes you a lot of time, especially for me who don't have any experience in coding before. I need to look up for sources on the Internet very often and it takes nights to finish...
As for the midterm and final, since an A4 double-sided cheatsheet is allowed, you don't need to memorize much. The key is to understand and know how to apply concepts, which I am struggling on...

reviews.author: Maurice
reviews.comment_content: Simple linear regression, multiple regression, residual analysis, model selection, single and multiple factors ANOVA, logistic regression and poisson regression
reviews.comment_teaching: Reading lecture notes every lectures. The only value for attending lectures is to learn using minitab.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments       10%
Minicase 1            10%
Minicase 2           20%
Midterm Exam      25%
Final Exam           35%

The mean grade for this course is C+.
Bad grade for 3000 level business course. Don't take it as elective for OM.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload for this course is high, with 4 assignments and 2 minicases.

All assignments and minicases are done in groups. Finding good teammates are essential.
